p: The analysis was performed by determining the length and density of DNA in the “tail” based on which of the nucleoids (comets) were classified into five groups, as described by Anderson et al. (1994) [ 58]: A—without the “tail” (<5% DNA damage), B—low degree of damage (5–20%), C—medium degree of damage (20–40%), D—high degree of damage (40–95%) and E—complete DNA damage (>95%). The degree of total DNA damage was expressed as the sum of all DNA damage/migrations over 5% (B + C + D + E).
